readability_reflection: I found string interpolation to be more readable as I can easily see where the variables would be inserted as well as any surrounding white space.
comprehension_debugging: With concatenation, it would take more time time as I would have to refer to variables above and insert them in a string in my head. String interpolation got a little confusing with integers though.
preference_rationale: I would prefer string interpolation because it's easier to read. With string concatenation, you have to be more careful with the spaces and such while with string interpolation you can easily see if there's a space between a string variable or not.
learning_curve: Having experience using string interpolation in JavaScript and f-strings in Python helped a lot as I have some familiarity of how it works. Concatenation I've seen time to time with C++.
